title: Widespread Racial Bias Found in Home Appraisals
description: Researchers found evidence of a persistent practice that gives higher values to homes when the occupants are white, and devalue them if the owners are people of color.
dc:creator: Debra Kamin
media:description: Last week, the Federal Housing Finance Agency released 47 million appraisal reports to the public for the first time, and researches found widespread bias.
